chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent
Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Gregory Michael Shilts was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take/Drive Veh. w/o Consent-Abandon Veh., a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Sentencing hearing on June 15, 2015 at 04:00 pm.

CO: Vlack, DAR: Frank, Clerk: Liddle. ADA:  Sharon Correll   DF ATTY:  Shirlene Renee Perrin   DF:  Gregory Michael Shilts appeared. Case called at 4:03 p.m. ADA Correll states a proposed diversion agreement. 6 month agreement, pay restitution, attend outreach session and then would be amended from a felony to a misdemeanor. Victims have been notified. Compass evalution was completed. Court reviews. Atty Perrin states that the proposed agreement is correct.   Court reviews constitutional rights with def. Court finds def freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights. Set for a hearing in June. Bond conditions stay in affect while the diversion agreement is in affect.  Court reads charge and possible penalties for count one Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent. , def pleads GUILTY. Court uses complaints and reports as factual basis, accepts plea and adjudicates def guilty of count 1. Defer conviction at this time. Court approves diversion agreement. Attorney fees defendant has been paying. ADA Correll asks defendant to check in with Ms. Multhauf before he leaves. Set hearing for mid June. Address confirmed. Bond continues. Defendant has copy of agreement. hml  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 04:00 pm.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Status conference on August 14, 2014 at 04:30 pm.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Merit Chevrolet.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

CO: Vlack, DAR, Frank, Clerk: Minot,ADA:   Sharon Ann Correll   DF ATTY:  Joseph R. Caton   DF:  Gregory Michael Shilts appeared from jail.   Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands. Def does not qualify for PD. km  Status conference scheduled for August 14, 2014 at 04:30 pm.
